tweets.text:
There are a number of flood warnings in place across England, with heavy rainfall expected in the next few days.

By knowing what to do in a #flood, you can reduce the impacts to your home, family and possessions.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY 

#StormCristoph https://t.co/FMPUiziILV

Over the coming days heavy rain is forecast for Yorkshire and the North East as #StormChristoph hits the region.  To sign up for flood alerts please visit the @EnvAgency website https://t.co/08qhBLjngI people can also call our Incident Hotline on 0800 80 70 60 #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/z5e85DblaG

We know it will happen, yet we still manage the hills to give them the water absorption capacity of tarmac. Stop burning & stop over-grazing to ensure our hills can absorb these storms. Sandbags are not the answer. @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/d5JSR8Ja5N

tweets.text:
@LancasterCC sweeping teams will be out about into the night.

All we can do though is keep channels clear. 

In some areas the volume of water will be so great it will be a case of waiting for it to drain.

Seen lots of @LancashireCC @LancsPolice @EnvAgencyNW  @LancashireFRS https://t.co/HkNzNiUoeE

@olylowe @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @powell_peter @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils Unlikely. Courts are in crisis. Huge backlog. EA just talking, cajoling, with little effect. It is grim. All over pastoral lowlands. I report but EA officers restricted to quiet chats. Now there's a planning moratorium across 80% of Mendip District. And THIS is why. https://t.co/S6kNItJiGJ

tweets.text:
There are #FloodWarnings in place as #StormChristoph brings heavy rain across England.  

Know what to do in a flood and check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7Fwblnq  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/MaE7ptFod2

#StormChristoph: If you live near areas prone to flooding in England, you're being urged to prepare for rising water levels this week. #ukweather 
More here‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/m6bYFjEzXU
üëáHere's @EnvAgency latest #flood timeline for the next few days. https://t.co/Zhq6XpPk48
Flood alert issued for River Kent & River Bela by @EnvAgency. Be prepared, visit: https://t.co/gXDoiZtybx https://t.co/yHc7y7K0Tg

Adrian Gill from the Environment Agency is urging people to stay away from swollen rivers and warning motorists not to drive through flood waters.
Read more:
https://t.co/DaJsR3SEaj https://t.co/AsXYgYHh4k

#StormChristoph continues to bring heavy rain across England. Stay safe at home - if you need to go outside, be alert to the hidden dangers of flood water and check your flood risk at: https://t.co/xNlgwQrrt9  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/H7wc6P2CXd

.@EnvAgency Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA tells @CommonsEFRA that #StormChristoph brings 24 to 48 hours of heavy rain to ground that is already saturated. #TeamEA on the ground working with partners to prepare. Check your flood risk here: https://t.co/CnoJPZIDpY https://t.co/DD7vHRRfXh

tweets.text: Dear @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency we have tweeted, emailed and called you. Please carry out your duty and clean the overflowing trash traps on the River Brent AND Silk Stream that feed into the Welsh Harp (Brent Reservoir). Please also provide timings. We eagerly await confirmation. https://t.co/H2DtdWx930

‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre asked to take action, then please do.‚Äù

The @EnvAgency is predicting to issue up to 40 flood warnings for the East Midlands, with flood alerts currently in place for the Lower Derwent and River Trent in Derbyshire. https://t.co/4ZnfHvU2lW

@olylowe @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils @suesustainable The most shocking thing (if this farm is in Wales and outside an NVZ) is that they aren't doing anything illegal.

With persistent heavy rainfall across the #Midlands today make sure you stay #floodaware 

‚ö†Ô∏èCheck your #flood risk: https://t.co/8HEpx2nkWv
‚ö†Ô∏èSign up for flood alerts:
https://t.co/4G9UCfW5wr

REMEMBER:‚ö†Ô∏è Never walk or drive through flood water! https://t.co/JoGOGP6DzU

Parts of Wales and northern England have already seen a lot of #rain üåßÔ∏è today courtesy of #StormChristoph 

Watch to the end to see the latest rainfall totals from @metoffice¬†@EnvAgency¬†@NatResWales¬† üëá

Stay #WeatherAware https://t.co/inAwObB67m

@EnvAgency's @JamesBevanEA says that while he is 'all for' reforming and reviewing environmental regulations, this should be done in a modern and proportionate way. He says that in the UK's economic recovery, some 'red tape' will be necessary to protect the environment.

We have #floodalerts and #floodwarnings in place across the North West. 

Check your flood risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/fiXvaBOMbi

tweets.text:
A dairy farmer, stuck up to their axles in mud whilst out spreading slurry during #StormChristoph on bare #maize stubble adjacent to a ditch.

There's been a big increase in illegal farm activities since the Covid started. Penalties should follow suit. https://t.co/TzA4AuUA0G

tweets.text:
Being prepared and knowing what to do in a #flood can reduce damage to your home and possessions by around 40%.

Find out what to do when you receive a flood warning and download our simple flood plan - https://t.co/vkHcHO9ADQ https://t.co/B44JQTpjSD

#StormChristoph: If you live near areas prone to flooding in England, you're being urged to prepare for rising water levels this week. #ukweather 
More here‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/m6bYFjEzXU
üëáHere's @EnvAgency latest #flood timeline for the next few days. https://t.co/Zhq6XpPk48

In particular, @EnvAgency highlight the need for more funding to deliver on their new flood plan, as well maintain existing flood defences, which may have aged, or may need to be adapted to cope with continued changes to the climate.

Following questions about the country's long term preparations for flooding, the Chair mentions the nation's flood and coastal erosion risk management strategy. You can read a blog about that here: https://t.co/PorpayTorP

‚ö†Ô∏è Advice from @EnvAgencyNW as #StormChristoph approaches.

Listen live for the latest
‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/BKIFOpFdCJ https://t.co/3KJbnN8UDI

#TeamEA have been in #Billington today ahead of #StormChristoph deploying temporary #flood barriers to better protect the community from flooding. 

Do you know your flood risk? Sign up for warnings here https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/wVMVE1n0B6

After repeated calls for urgent action on Government to provide Yorkshire wide flood plans and funding, they're continuing to ignore the issue and letting our communities down! Government must act ahead of a crisis not after! ‚ö†Ô∏è

Make sure you're following our partners for all of the latest info during #StormChristoph.
